clinical_study.brief_title: Follow-Up Study Evaluating the Long Term Outcome of ChondroMimetic in the Treatment of Osteochondral Defects in the Knee
clinical_study.official_title: Follow-Up Study Evaluating the Long-Term Outcomes of ChondroMimetic in the Treatment of Osteochondral Defects (Extension Study of Protocol 0MCM0107)

brief_summary.textblock: To investigate the long-term efficacy and safety of the medical device, ChondroMimetic, in subjects who were treated in the interventional study 0MCM0107 for osteochondral defects of the knee.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open-label, single center, extension study to the previous interventional study 0MCM0107 designed to investigate the long-term efficacy and safety of the medical device, ChondroMimetic, in the treatment of osteochondral defects of the knee. Follow-up to 6-months was completed as part of study 0MCM0107. All 17 subjects who received ChondroMimetic in study 0MCM0107 are eligible for enrolment into this extension study regardless of their current follow-up period.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from 0MCM0107 baseline in Modified Cincinnati Rating System
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0MCM0107 Baseline and through study completion, an average of approximately 8 years follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Subjective score designed to provide information regarding a patient's functional and clinical status after knee surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: KOOS (Knee injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of approximately 8 years follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Subjective score designed to provide information regarding a patient's functional and clinical status after knee surgery.

primary_outcome.measure: Cartilage repair tissue quantity and quality using 3D quantitative MRI analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of approximately 8 years follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Morphological segmentation utilizing a programmed anatomical atlas for all bone and cartilage structures will be used to assess defect filling (using previous MRI scans from study 0MCM0107 as reference), and T2 mapping for cartilage repair tissue quality.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of approximately 8 years follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Defect repair outcomes will be assessed using the magnetic resonance observation of cartilage repair tissue (MOCART) subjective radiological scoring system.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.time_frame: 0MCM0107 Baseline and through study completion, an average of approximately 8 years follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Long-term safety will be assessed by physical and knee examination, and subject history since original treatment in study 0MCM0107

arm_group.description: Treatment of osteochondral defect in the knee with Chondromimetic device(s) in previous study 0MCM0107

intervention.description: ChondroMimetic is a single-use, biphasic implant that serves as an osteochondral scaffold for the repair of cartilage defects in the knee

study_pop.textblock: All subjects were treated with a Chondromimetic device under Protocol 0MCM0107

criteria.textblock: Treated with a Chondromimetic device under Protocol 0MCM0107 and completed the required follow-up.
